meanings.definition: A cold-blooded vertebrate animal of a class that comprises the frogs, toads, newts, and salamanders.
meanings.sent1: The amphibian hopped from one lily pad to another.
meanings.sent2: I saw an interesting documentary about amphibians in the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The frog told a joke about a lazy amphibian who preferred swimming over hopping.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt to different environments made her an amphibian in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The colorful amphibian stood out among the green leaves.

meanings.definition: A vehicle or aircraft that can operate on land and in water.
meanings.sent1: The military used an amphibian to cross the river during the mission.
meanings.sent2: The amphibian slowly transitioned from the road to the lake seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The amphibian vehicle made the commute to work much more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her convertible was like an amphibian, smoothly switching between roads and beaches.
meanings.sent5: The amphibian aircraft landed gracefully on the water, impressing the spectators.
